DataElement.preferredName: Prescription Dose Per Body Weight Or Body Surface Area Continue At Reporting Period End Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information in regards to the prescribed dose according to body weight or body surface area at the end of a reporting period.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prescription Dose Per Body Weight Or Body Surface Area Continue At Reporting Period End
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A doctor's order for medicine or another intervention._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._For each, generally denoting a ratio._The weight of a subject._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing._Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption._Used to indicate position, location, or state._The act of providing a short account._An interval of time._The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A doctor's order for medicine or another intervention.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: A verbal or written order given by an authorized person instructing a patient to obtain and use a medical device, prescription or undergo a procedure.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Property.preferredName: Per Body Weight Or Body Surface Area Continue At Reporting Period End
Property.preferredDefinition: For each, generally denoting a ratio.:The weight of a subject.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.:Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.:Used to indicate position, location, or state.:The act of providing a short account.:An interval of time.:The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.

Concepts.definition: For each, generally denoting a ratio.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.
Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.
Used to indicate position, location, or state.
The act of providing a short account.
The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the prescribed dose per bo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the prescribed dose per body weight or BSA ongoing at the end of this reporting period?
